meanings.definition: To place or consider in a particular context.
meanings.sent1: She contextualizes the story by explaining the historical background.
meanings.sent2: The teacher contextualizes the new vocabulary words by using them in sentences.
meanings.sent3: He contextualizes the joke by adding a funny twist at the end.
meanings.sent4: The map contextualizes the location of the ancient ruins in relation to the modern city.
meanings.sent5: The photograph contextualizes the emotions of the moment captured in time.

meanings.sent1: The introduction contextualizes the main themes of the book.
meanings.sent2: The chart contextualizes the data by showing trends over time.
meanings.sent3: She contextualizes the recipe by sharing its origin story.
meanings.sent4: The prologue contextualizes the events leading up to the main story.
meanings.sent5: The painting contextualizes the artist's unique perspective on nature.
